hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Forecasting: Implement segment-weighted forecast totals using Customer_Analyzer fit tiers.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds segment-weighted forecast totals to our forecasting aggregation pipeline by applying configurable weights based on the Customer_Analyzer “fit tier” (e.g., A/B/C). Instead of treating all opportunities equally, we’ll adjust opportunity amounts/probabilities by tier weight and then roll them up to produce weighted totals that better reflect expected performance by customer segment.

From a product impact perspective, this improves forecast accuracy and trust for GTM leaders by incorporating a consistent, centrally-defined “quality” signal into topline numbers. It also enables faster iteration on forecasting strategy (tuning tier weights) without changing the UI or requiring per-report logic, making the system more adaptable as our understanding of segment performance evolves.

On the platform/API side, we’ll expose both raw and weighted totals via the forecast API. This ensures the UI can render toggles or side-by-side views (raw vs weighted) while keeping the logic authoritative in the backend, reducing duplication, inconsistency risk, and maintenance overhead across clients.

The weighting will work across existing scenario buckets (baseline/commit/best-case) so teams can compare scenarios apples-to-apples under the same weighting scheme. When a fit tier is missing, the system will fall back gracefully (e.g., default/unweighted behavior) to avoid breaking totals and to keep results stable while data quality improves.
